speaker: Outstanding Guest Actor in a Comedy Series
text: Harris Yulin  * * *  ## Transcript {abby fletcher}     _ACT ONE  Scene One - Apartment The scene opens with Daphne sitting at the table eating her breakfast. Martin is sitting in a chair against the door.  Frasier enters from the direction of the bedrooms._

speaker: Frasier
text: Morning Daphne, Dad.
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Guest Actor in a Comedy Series

speaker: Daphne
text: Shhh! [_re: Martin_] You'll ruin his concentration!  He's on a stakeout to catch whoever's been pinching our newspaper.  He's been at it for over an hour!  I must say, I can see why he was such a good policeman. _Frasier walks over towards his father to investigate.  Loud snoring soon becomes apparent._

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, very impressive, isn't he?  When he wakes up you must get him to tell you about his stint as security coordinator for Jimmy Hoffa!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, come on, rise and shine.

speaker: Martin
text: [_waking up_] Huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: You fell asleep. [_he opens the door_] Oh, good morning, Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_looking for the paper_] Ah yes, I see our newspaper thief has struck again!

speaker: Martin
text: Damn, he's good! _Martin crosses to sit by Daphne at the table.  Frasier moves the chair back to where it should be.  Niles follows him over to the table._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Niles_] Come on in.

speaker: Niles
text: This morning, for the first time since our separation, Maris actually picked up the phone and called me!  She needs a favour.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well Niles, I think that's hardly cause to celebrate.  She called you just because she wants something?

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, not "wants," Frasier; "needs."  This is my chance to show her how necessary I really am to her, and all I have to do is fix one small problem!

speaker: Martin
text: What's the problem?

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, she's wanted by the police.  Apparently, she was driving past a shoe store last week, when she spotted a stunning pair of Ferragamo pumps.  Well, I need not remind you what effect a Ferragamo sighting can have on Maris's hand-eye coordination. She drove up on the sidewalk, and when the police ran her name through the computer they found quite a little backlog of unpaid parking tickets!

speaker: Frasier
text: What else would you expect from a woman who thinks her chocolate allergy entitles her to park in a handicapped space?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, and to top it all off she neglected to appear for her summons, and so they immediately swore out a warrant, and that brings us to you, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Why?

speaker: Niles
text: You were a cop.  I'm sure you still have "chums," hint-hint? Who could lend you a hand, wink-wink?

speaker: Martin
text: No.  Look, you know I'd do anything for you, but not this. All my years on the force I never even fixed a ticket, let alone an arrest warrant.

speaker: Niles
text: You couldn't pull one little string?

speaker: Martin
text: No, I hope everything works out for you, but I think the law should be the same for everyone.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, it's not.  We'd all like to believe that justice is blind, but the sad truth is, wealthy white women just can't get a fair shake!  The courts love to make examples of them.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, they do.  Just think of Zsa Zsa Gabor, or Leona Helmsley.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sarcastic_] Oh yes, two perfectly lovely women victimised by an unjust system.

speaker: Niles
text: Alright, fine. [_standing_] If you won't help me, I'll just have to help myself. [_goes towards door_] I'm going down to that precinct house, and I'm not leaving until I get justice.  Well, not exactly justice, I suppose, more like preferential treatment, but I'm not leaving 'til I get it! [_exits via front door_]

speaker: Daphne
text: What a horrible thing to happen.  Can you picture poor Mrs. Crane confined to a jail cell?

speaker: Frasier
text: Only if they moved the bars closer together.   **THE LITTLE COMMODORE**  _Scene Two - KACL Fade in to the KACL studio booth, where Frasier is wrapping up his show for the day._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's it for today, folks!  This is Dr. Frasier Crane wishing you good mental health!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, I feel as if I'm being sucked into a vortex of rage and despair!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, right back atcha!  I take it things didn't go down so well at the station?

speaker: Niles
text: The police simply would not listen to reason.

speaker: Roz
text: [_entering from producer's booth_] Police?

speaker: Niles
text: They're persecuting my Maris over some silly parking fines. I felt sure they'd ease up if they understood Maris a little better, so I tried to explain her to them.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear God.

speaker: Roz
text: You know, I dated a guy once who got in trouble with the cops...

speaker: Niles
text: Notice the complete absence of gasps following that statement.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh!  OK fine, you little weasel.  Just forget it.  I was going to help you, but Maris can just rot in the slammer.

speaker: Niles
text: [_suddenly very apologetic_] Ooh Roz, I was joshing!  I know how you enjoy our little by-play!  That weasel line, ouch, touche!

speaker: Roz
text: You know what, you're even more annoying when you grovel.

speaker: Niles
text: Zing!  Got me again!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, if not for his sake, then for mine, please?

speaker: Roz
text: OK, for you.  My friend Phil had some major traffic violations, and he was so freaked that he called this guy who, you know, fixes things.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sounds just a tad shady, Roz.  You mean he went to some hoodlum?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I wouldn't use the word "hoodlum" in front of him. [_Searches her rolodex_] Just think of him as a guy who makes wishes come true.  Like a fairy godfather.  Another word I wouldn't use in front of him. [_finds the card_] Here we go!  Jerome Belasco.

speaker: Niles
text: [_takes the card_] Oh Roz, you are an angel of mercy.  How can I repay you?

speaker: Roz
text: The next time you think of some witty little thing to say about my sex life, or what I'm wearing, just keep it to yourself.

speaker: Niles
text: [_looking her up and down, searching for something nice to say_] Consider it done.

speaker: Niles
text: Give me that!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, give me that!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you mad?  I will not have you turning a minor, albeit annoying situation into a, a Martin Scorsese film!

speaker: Niles
text: You don't understand what this means to me.  When Maris asked me for this favour, do you know what she said?  She said, "Niles, will you be my Commodore?"

speaker: Frasier
text: Her Commodore?

speaker: Niles
text: That's what she used to call her father.  Frasier, there was no problem so great that that man couldn't fix it.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sure.

speaker: Niles
text: Remember that lovely jeweled crucifix Maris picked up on her first communion trip to Rome?  Who do you think smoothed things over with the Vatican?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, whatever happened to the days when a parent would take a wayward child by the hand, march them back to the scene of the crime and make them say, "I'm sorry, Your Holiness, it'll never happen again"?

speaker: Niles
text: You don't understand.  If I show Maris that I can step into the Commodore's plimsolls, she'll have a whole new respect for me.  We can rebuild our marriage on a healthier foundation.  Frasier, please.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.  I just know this man is the answer to my problems.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, who better to mend the fragile fabric of a troubled marriage than a man whose business address is a wharf!   **A WORD TO THE WISEGUY**  _Scene Three - Outside Caf e Nervosa late at night. Frasier and Niles are sitting at one of the tables drinking coffee._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, look.  This is ridiculous, it's past midnight. I'm leaving.

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, no, you can't leave.  You're my backup.  I wonder what's keeping him? _At this point a man in his late 40's enters the scene, wearing a long dark overcoat.  He sits opposite the boys at another of the outside tables._

speaker: Frasier
text: Do you suppose that's him?

speaker: Niles
text: [_scoffs_] I doubt it, that overcoat is Armani!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sarcastically_] Good point, Niles.  Where would a criminal come up with the money for something like that? _The man looks at them and Frasier waves his hand.  The man then stands and crosses to meet them. The boys also stand._

speaker: Jerome
text: Oh, Dr. Crane, I presume?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, yes.  I'm Niles Crane, this is my brother, Dr. Frasier Crane.

speaker: Jerome
text: Jerome Belasco. [_shakes hands with Frasier_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Pleasure.

speaker: Jerome
text: Excuse my tardiness, but my lady friend and I were having one of those discussions from which it is difficult to remove oneself.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Niles_] Yes, we certainly know about those, don't we?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, dames!

speaker: Jerome
text: So you have some problem you think I can help you with?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I do.  Please, Jerome.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, you see, last week my lady got on the wrong side of "Larry Law," and since then certain, shall we say, "complications" have arisen, and in brief, things have got "hot-hot-hot," and we believe you are the man to "turn on the air conditionin'."

speaker: Jerome
text: I sense you're a film buff, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Just show him the charges, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: [_getting charge sheet out of pocket_] Yes, here we are. Quite a few. [_hands sheet to Jerome_]

speaker: Jerome
text: [_reading_] "Ignoring a summons, speeding, reckless endangerment." Your wife sounds like a very carefree lady.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes.  She's ounces of fun.

speaker: Niles
text: Do you think you could persuade the police to show some leniency?

speaker: Jerome
text: Well, there's never any harm in making a phone call.  Excuse me.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you!  Yes, around and straight to the back.

speaker: Niles
text: [_excitedly_] He's making the call!  He's making the call! Frasier, you're going to think I'm mad for saying this, but... that was fun!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I must admit, Niles, it is not entirely unpleasant to rub shoulders with the _demi-monde_.  I definitely felt a real testosterone surge, you know?

speaker: Niles
text: Me too, me too!  It's like an actual tingling in my chest. And now it's gone... there it is again! ...and now it's gone.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, it must be your cellular phone vibrating.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, it is!  You're right. [_he reaches into his inside pocket and takes out the phone_] Hello?  Oh hello, Maris!  Yes, I'm tending to that very matter right now. [_he sees Jerome approaching_] Oh, just wait a second.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well?

speaker: Jerome
text: You may consider the matter dealt with.

speaker: Niles
text: Maris, it's all taken care of... What did you say?  No, I've just never heard those words before.  You're welcome. [_he hangs up the phone_] Oh Jerome, thank you!

speaker: Jerome
text: Now, if you'll excuse me gentlemen, I've got another business engagement.

speaker: Frasier
text: At this hour of the night? [_looks at watch_] My God, it's past midnight. What kind of business could it possibly be [_realises what he's saying_] ...of mine where you're going! [_laughs nervously_]

speaker: Niles
text: Tell me, what do I owe you? [_Takes out wallet_]

speaker: Jerome
text: Oh, nothing.  I was happy I could help.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, don't be silly.  I insist!

speaker: Jerome
text: Consider it a favour.  I was in a position to help you. Perhaps someday you'll be in a position to help me. [_he stands to leave_]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I would love that.  If there's ever anything I can do for you, just say the word.

speaker: Jerome
text: You're very kind.  It was a pleasure meeting you both.

speaker: Niles
text: And you. [_calling after Jerome as he leaves_]  And I meant that!  Anything at all, you just let me know! _As soon as Jerome is gone, Niles realizes his mistake even before noticing Frasier's appalled look._

speaker: Niles
text: [_shaking his head_] I shouldn't have said that, should I?  _END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO_  **DOESN'T EVERYONE HAVE POI RAMEKINS?**  _Scene Four - Back at Frasier's apartment. Niles and Frasier enter, wearing their squash kit.  Jerome is already in the flat, talking with Martin and Daphne._

speaker: Jerome
text: Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Jerome!  Look Niles, it's Jerome! [_sotto voce_] In my house!

speaker: Daphne
text: We've been having the most delightful chat.

speaker: Jerome
text: Dr. Crane, you're a lucky young man to have such a charming young woman in your employ.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_obviously flattered_] Oh, go on.  Did you know his brother supplied the cement for this very building?

speaker: Niles
text: What a small world, oh look at the time!

speaker: Martin
text: So Jerome, you didn't tell us what line of work you're in.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh wait, let me guess! [_to Jerome_] I'm a bit psychic.  Let's see... you're some sort of doctor.  An osteopath, perhaps?

speaker: Jerome
text: No.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well that's odd.  I can see you hovering over people with broken bones.

speaker: Martin
text: [_standing_] Boys, why don't you help me get some refreshments for your new friend?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes!  Excuse us, Jerome!

speaker: Martin
text: Who the hell is this guy?

speaker: Niles
text: He's some hooligan who helped fix Maris's legal problem, and in return I promised him a favour.  Oh God, do you think that's why he's here?  To collect?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sarcastically_] No, Niles.  He's probably having a luau and he came to borrow our Poi Ramekins!

speaker: Martin
text: Are you guys nuts?  You don't get involved with somebody like that!

speaker: Niles
text: Wait, before we panic, we should at least talk to him.  You know, get the "straight dope."  Also known as "the skinny."

speaker: Frasier
text: Knock it off, Bugsy!  _They re-enter the living room, Frasier carrying a tray with a jug of Orange Squash on it.  Jerome is talking to Daphne._

speaker: Jerome
text: Stealing newspapers is most un-neighbourly behaviour.  If you would like I could find out who's doing it, and make sure they never even think...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_interrupting_] Oh no!  No!  That's fine!

speaker: Niles
text: So Jerome, is there something we can do for you?

speaker: Jerome
text: Since you ask, you may recall the other evening I mentioned my lady friend?  If I may... _He reaches into his breast pocket, and Niles and Frasier clutch together, thinking he's about to pull out a gun, when he instead pulls out several photographs._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh!  She's a pretty thing, isn't she!

speaker: Jerome
text: This is at the dog track where we met.  And here's our first Sinatra Concert.  And this was at the funeral of a business associate.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, for the life of me, I can't recall ever having seen a woman wearing so many different kinds of furs all at the same time.

speaker: Jerome
text: Well, Brandy is a uniquely stylish woman.

speaker: Niles
text: Brandy?

speaker: Jerome
text: Yeah, the traditional spelling. _The Crane boys all look at each other, trying to work out when "Brandy" started to classify as a traditional name._

speaker: Jerome
text: We've been engaged for eight years, but she refuses to set a wedding date.  This upsets me.  It also upsets my mother, whose comments on the subject are frequent and vivid.

speaker: Martin
text: So where do these two come in?

speaker: Jerome
text: Well, if she's reluctant to marry me, obviously she needs therapy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you're in luck!  Niles happens to be one of the finest marriage counselers in all of Seattle!

speaker: Jerome
text: Well actually, Dr. Crane, I would prefer it if Brandy spoke to you.

speaker: Frasier
text: To me?

speaker: Jerome
text: [_to Niles_] No offense to you, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: [_very relieved_] Oh, none taken!

speaker: Jerome
text: She's a great fan of your show.  I'm sure she'd heed any advice that you might care to offer.  Such as "Marry him. Promptly."  But I'm not here to put words into your mouth. You'll know what to say. [_he gets up to leave_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Jerome, you know I'm a psychiatrist.  I'm used to rendering my opinion, not being a mouthpiece for someone else.  I'm not sure I'm comfortable with this.

speaker: Jerome
text: Dr. Crane, there are some times in life we must do unpleasant things.  I'd hate to tell you some of the unpleasant things I've had to do.

speaker: Frasier
text: I see.  Well then, why don't you just give Brandy my unlisted home number, which I'm sure you came across when you were finding out where I lived.  I'll be glad to chat with her.

speaker: Jerome
text: Thank you.  She'll be in touch. [_shakes Frasier's hand_] And I hope that one day you'll dance at my wedding.

speaker: Frasier
text: If I'm able to dance.

speaker: Martin
text: If you ask me, you're getting off easy.  He could have asked you for a much bigger favour.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, how can I possibly as a self-respecting psychiatrist tell any woman to marry that thug?

speaker: Daphne
text: What are you talking about?  He seemed very nice to me.

speaker: Frasier
text: This coming from the psychic who thought he was a chiropractor!

speaker: Martin
text: Listen, I've heard your show.  One more piece of half-assed advice isn't going to kill you.

speaker: Martin
text: Jerome, on the other hand...

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay, dad!  _Fade out.  Scene Five Fade in to Frasier's booth at KACL, where he is mid-show._

speaker: Frasier
text: The key to lasting weight-loss is to change the way you view food everyday.  You can't go on through life binging and then starving yourself for two weeks just to fit into that gorgeous new evening gown you've bought for a special occasion.  Can you understand that?

speaker: Steve
text: [_v.o._] Yeah.  Thanks Doc.

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't mention it, Steve.  Roz, who's our next caller?

speaker: Roz
text: We have Randy, from Richmond Beach.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello Randy, I'm listening.

speaker: Brandy
text: Not Randy, Brandy. [_Frasier looks suddenly worried_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Brandy?

speaker: Brandy
text: The traditional spelling.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know we're all out of time, my goodness I feel so sorry but...

speaker: Roz
text: No, you're not.  We've got five minutes left!

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Roz!  Alright Brandy, go ahead.  Your problem, please.

speaker: Brandy
text: It's my boyfriend, Jerome.  He said I should call you. We've been semi-engaged for eight years, and he wants to get married.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I can certainly hear the love in your voice, so I say case closed, best of luck to you in the future!

speaker: Brandy
text: Whoa!  You got a bus to catch?!  There's a lot more to it. For starters I think he's cheated on me.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, in my experience, if you suspect something like that, nine out of ten times you're right.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I think a little mistrust adds mystery to a relationship. _Roz starts to look perplexed at Frasier's opinions.  He gives her a little stare as if to say "Shut up and play along!"_

speaker: Brandy
text: Mystery I could stand if he didn't neglect me so much.  Every time we go for a romantic dinner he gets a phone call and bang, it's "Gotta work babe, finish your lobster.  I'll send you a limo."

speaker: Frasier
text: Lobster?  Limos?  My God, give me his number and I'll marry him!

speaker: Brandy
text: Money ain't everything, especially when you've got a sex life like ours...

speaker: Roz
text: He's not even good in bed?

speaker: Brandy
text: Who knows?  We're never there long enough to find out!

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, this really isn't necessary...

speaker: Brandy
text: I said to him last night, "What the hell was that?!  I've been vaccinated slower!"

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that just leaves more time to cuddle!

speaker: Roz
text: Can I say something?

speaker: Frasier
text: No!

speaker: Brandy
text: Look, I could deal with the other problems, if it weren't for one thing.  All my life I've dreamed of being a career woman, but he says I'm not allowed to work!  I'm supposed to sit home all day, let him take care of me.  So, what do you think Doc?  Should I marry him?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... taking into account the years you've invested in the relationship, and Jerome's obvious love for you, not to mention his generosity...

speaker: Brandy
text: Tell me what you think Dr. Crane 'cause I really, really respect you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Brandy... run! [_Roz holds up two thumbs_] Save yourself. Do not marry this man. [_he presses the button to cut her off_] This is Dr Frasier Crane, saying goodbye, and see you, God willing, tomorrow.  _Fade out.  Scene Six Fade in at Caf e Nervosa.  Frasier is sitting at a table on his own, ordering a drink from a passing waiter._

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I'll have a non-fat, decaf latte, please.  Oh, what the hell?  Look, make it a full-fat mocha with extra whipped cream.  What the hell, put a slice of bacon on it! _Niles approaches Frasier, who is sitting with his back to him. Niles clamps his hand down on Frasier's shoulder, and Frasier jumps, terrified._

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!  Don't do that!

speaker: Niles
text: Sorry. [_to waiter_] Double espresso, please. [_to Frasier_] I heard you on the radio today.  I thought what you did Was noble. [_pause_] To what South American nation will you be fleeing?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, like I'd tell you.  One minute of interrogation and you would crack like a Jordan almond!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, I never meant for any of this to happen.  How long are you going to stay mad at me?

speaker: Frasier
text: For as long as I live.  Which'll probably take us through breakfast.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, wrong again!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, oh look!  It's Jerome Belasco!  Jerome, take a seat! Look Frasier, it's our friend, [_turns to lady sitting behind them_] _Jerome Belasco._ _They all sit down, Frasier and Niles very nervously.  There is an ominous silence._

speaker: Jerome
text: I heard your broadcast this afternoon.  It displeased me. [_the waitress comes over to get his order_] Yeah, let me have a little hot milk, please.  When I'm displeased I get acid in my stomach, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Believe me, the last thing I wanted to do is displease you. Or to hear the words "acid" and "Dr. Crane" in the same sentence.  But - Jerome, I'm sorry - how could I have advised her otherwise?  She said that you cheated on her.

speaker: Jerome
text: She said she suspected me!  I've never cheated on Miss Brandy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Alright, be that as it may, how can I advise her to marry a man who's so controlling that he won't even allow her to work?

speaker: Jerome
text: It may interest you to know that over the years I've called in favours to get Miss Brandy fourteen jobs!  She lost all of them.

speaker: Frasier
text: So you're saying she's had trouble finding her niche?

speaker: Jerome
text: No, I'm saying she's a dodo.  Now you may love a dodo; you may think the dodo is beautiful; you may even wish to marry the dodo.  But you do not encourage a dodo to fly!  Now, when she loses these jobs it makes her very unhappy.  So for her sake I said "No more jobs."  But now, in order to convince her to marry me, I've had to reverse this policy.

speaker: Frasier
text: So she has agreed to marry you?

speaker: Jerome
text: If I get her a job.  And not just any job.  A job that she can never lose.  A job where if she burns the place down, they will apologise to her for having made it so flammable.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, good luck finding someone who'll hire her. _Jerome and Frasier look at Niles, then each other, then Niles again. He gives a little moan of realisation.  FADE OUT.  Scene Seven Fade in to Frasier's apartment. Daphne and Martin are sitting at the table, eating.  Frasier enters, obviously just having had a shower._

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, your brother called.  The court time for your tennis game is 11 o'clock.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, good Lord.  I distinctly told him I wasn't available until noon.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, if you're going to call him back, put it on the speakerphone.

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't you think this is getting a little old?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well I think it's just mean, is what I think.

speaker: Martin
text: So sue me, I enjoy it.

speaker: Brandy
text: [_v.o._] Good morning!  Niles Crane, psy-kee-at-trist.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, is Dr. Crane there?  This is his brother, Frasier.

speaker: Brandy
text: Oh hi, Dr. Crane.  It's me, Brandy.  Hang on, I'm getting another call. _She presses the wrong button and cuts Frasier off.  Martin bursts into hysterics again.  FADE OUT  END OF ACT TWO_
